website_summaries.verdict: A good step up from budget radar detectors that does not go overboard with the price and included features.
pros: Unique dual alert display shows the side from which a signal is coming
Comes with different city and highway models to increase detection reliability in different conditions
Vehicle battery saver shuts off detector when not in use
cons: Garage door openers can cause device to detect false signal

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Radar Detector, right in the sweetspot for price and value
customer_reviews.text: After driving a lot with this thing, I have no complaints. It picks up radar really well, around corners and over hills, and has never failed to alert me to a trooper or speedtrap. There have been maybe a couple times when ti has gone off without there being an officer nearby, however I would rather err on the side of false alarms than no alarms.
customer_reviews.author: R. Kuhns

customer_reviews.title: Not even worth the $27 paid. Wanted to get ...
customer_reviews.text: Not even worth the $27 paid. Wanted to get get something cheap ASAP and got this to cover the time while my R1 is gone for a warranty replacement. Volume is extremely weak, barely audible with windows merely cracked open. Absolutely inaudible on a motorcycle even at slow speeds. One visual alert for both K and Ka so you how no idea if it's a legit signal. It alerts for every single blind spot sensor, and of course nothing to differentiate between that and any real threat. Yet it barely detects a K band sensor I pass every day that my R1 alerts to from 100 yards out and then pegs out the R1 as I pass by.
customer_reviews.author: TM

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: I was a little skeptical at first, but once I got it on the main road I drive on everyday, it did save me from a cop! Although I do feel embarrassed when I stop right next to a cop and they see my detector. This doesn’t have great rear detection, but it does detect radio and laser from a good distance away. And it is insanely inexpensive for what you get! Definitely worth buying and combining with veil.... they will never get you again! 😉
customer_reviews.author: Brendan

customer_reviews.title: If you are a responsible driver like me who every once in a while will be ...
customer_reviews.text: Incredible value for the price! I do not speed or drive hard; Yet on several occasions i was distracted and SAVED by this product!!! If you are a responsible driver like me who every once in a while will be driving downhill or too fast, then this is for you. The first time it GOES OFF, you brake, & THEN see the LEO (LawEnforcementOfficer) who radars you going the speed limit=It just paid for itself. Its a solid choice for such little cost.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I was surprised at the quality and performance of this detector.
customer_reviews.text: For $19 this is a steal. I have owned multiple detectors ranging from the most expensive to the least (this one). But I was surprised at the quality and performance of this detector and I have only owned it a week. Even better, I believe it might have saved me from a ticket yesterday. With collision avoidance radar standard on many new cars, my previous detector false alarmed constantly. This XTR-130 occasionally gets fooled but less often. A road I often drive has a fixed K-band radar displaying speed and the XTR-130 starts alarming at the same spot my previous detector did so the sensitivity is the same. In summary, this was a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Saline Bayou

customer_reviews.title: ... the radar just once and seemed to work just fine when detecting a speed radar
customer_reviews.text: I have only used the radar just once and seemed to work just fine when detecting a speed radar , which is the reason I bought it.so I am quite pleased with the product and look forward to utilising it for all our long journeys.
customer_reviews.author: dlint

customer_reviews.title: Best Bang for the BUCK
customer_reviews.text: I was considering a 200 or 300 detector based on some YT reviews, glad I stayed stingy and went for this instead. This detector does an EXCELLENT job. If you live in a rural area or even a smaller suburb you shouldn't need all of the filtering provided by a more expensive radar, this should do. It already saved me from one possible pullover/ticket, I was behind a slow driver and would have had to speed to get around, the device started going off so I waited and sure enough there was a LEO about a mile ahead running radar.
customer_reviews.author: buyer 38920

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the price!
customer_reviews.text: This bad boy payed for itself, and then some. Got me out of a ticket with a state trooper being sneaky down the road. Wasn't speeding but was about to chase my friend down, who got a fat ticket! Catches every radar on the road, including assisted driving. For every 50 beeps though its a cop and it is for sure worth it. Note not every cop has their radar on all the time, the comments on this product fail to realise this. This thing goes ballistic within the presence of speed catching radar.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Jerman

customer_reviews.title: You get what you paid for
customer_reviews.text: I'm not gonna bash it, for the low price it works. It's not the best scanner out there by no means, but if your looking for a cheap temporary scanner than this is the one you'd want.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler McCarty

customer_reviews.title: The instructions are not terribly detailed on what all the functions are.
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this thing is a hell of a good deal. It works, its accurate enough, and if youre looking for a radar detector for a low price, this is it. It does have a tendency to chirp at big trucks. Whether its picking up c-band transmissions or GPS signals, i dont know. But it does tell you when radar is being used, and has a feature to tell you if cops have a radar detector detector. Also, though it has 360° coverage, there is no indicator to tell you from which direction signals are coming.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not Reliable
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this unit 3 years so it’s finally time to give fair assessment. It was originally purchased when moving into Massachusetts because the cops here are a bit ticket happy. It picks up on interference when you’re near fire departments and shopping centers more consistently than actually catching signals from nearby police. I’ve probably avoided a handful of tickets during these past few years but I’ve also received a number of tickets as well. Seems to NOT pick up laser readings well so I’m now in the market for something better.
customer_reviews.author: SleepySin

customer_reviews.title: i have passed well over 15+ cops and so far it has alerted me about one
customer_reviews.text: im not just another uneducated person that doesnt know how a radar detector works. i have been using this radar detector in specific for about a week and i have passed well over 15+ cops and so far it has alerted me about one! i understand that sometimes cops dont have their radar on but all of them? i dont think so. one thing this radar never fails to do is alert me when a traffic light is in front of me.. so i guess if i were blind, this radar detector would help me not run a red light..
customer_reviews.author: Drake Anderson

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Sits on dash without moving. Beeps loud and clear but doesnt alwasy detect radar until after you've passed it. Sometimes it works great and sometimes it doesnt work at all. If you want a solid beeper than just invest in a cobra. I would have bought one if i had known that this one works the way it does. I tried to save money, and now i regret it, but this is still very useful. It doesnt beep for laser detection but works for traditional radar about 60-70% of the time. Sometimes itll be a mile before the radar. Most times it wont beep until 2 seconds before passing radar.
customer_reviews.author: Eean Pitcock

customer_reviews.title: So many false reports
customer_reviews.text: Would go off all the time for no reason. Does detect radar and laser though. Annoying to the point I don't use it anymore
customer_reviews.author: Shaylee larson

customer_reviews.title: Not the same detector.
customer_reviews.text: Not the same detector as others I have used before. Have used a couple detectors with the same brand and model number, alerts and chirp sounds are much different. Not sure if the differences are a change by the manufacturing which should be accompanied with a model number difference, a copy/look alike or result of the refurbishing process. This item did not have the red X on top as part of the XTR model marking . This model is no longer available new, will have to choose a newer model and hope for good performance like I've been accustom to. Either way this was not the same as the others I have experience with. Returned for refund.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works best and worth the money
customer_reviews.text: This my second radar detector from same company. This one purchased for my wife. It works just fine. Only thing is it don’t have a hard switch for city and highway modes. So every time I turn it on I have to change it to city mode because highway is default mode. Also there is no hard switch for silent mode. Otherwise this works just fine and it has saved me from a ticket so many times.
customer_reviews.author: MK

customer_reviews.title: Works well when it works, but breaks easily
customer_reviews.text: This is a great price for a really well functioning radar detector. If you're new to radar detectors it's not any different from a similar ~$100 model, but they seem to break very easily - I had one dead on arrival, and another that's now not functional 5 months after purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Eberle

customer_reviews.title: needs work
customer_reviews.text: I bought this one as my other one went out and was quite old. I guess I was used to the other one as this one seems to detect everything. At first it was picking up every truck that went by. It seems to have adjusted some to this, but then I haven't been on a long trip since the first time I used it. My brother and I took a short trip and we tried to figure it out, we decided it just went off on just about everything. It triggers with lights, trucks, etc. There is no difference in signals. I wouldn't waste my money, though not expensive, not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Effective unit, used only for Interstate travel and secondary highway roads. Picks up radar early and minimal interference from non-Police screens. Only issue relates to the adhesive cups, they are terrible and sensitive to temp of windshield, constantly adjusting.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Meh.
customer_reviews.text: It detects the frequencies needed, but that also includes a lot of things that are not cops so it beeps A LOT. Also, doesn't detect fast enough to keep you from getting pulled over, so don't do 77 in a 55 and think you're safe.......
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Drew

customer_reviews.title: Obsolete but usable
customer_reviews.text: Even though it is very obsolete now, we still use this every day and it's good enough.
customer_reviews.author: My Name Is Nobody

customer_reviews.title: Does it’s job
customer_reviews.text: Detects a lot and does it’s job very well and saved me from a lot of police infested areas that I drive in, but in and lot of neighborhoods and cvs areas the thing gives of false alarms, but that’s okay because with a touch of the button you can change the intensity of how much it detects so you don’t even have to worry.
customer_reviews.author: Oniccai

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Of you live around wealthy towns this thing goes off constantly, all German cars, and Volvo's, and most Cadillacs will set this off because of parking and blind spot sensors. But once you get to know it you can trust it.
customer_reviews.author: C&Ks dad

customer_reviews.title: ... couple of stated back and forth to work he loved having it keeping him aware of anything that he ...
customer_reviews.text: This radar detector was a gift to a traveling son just for precaution as he traveled long distant between couple of stated back and forth to work he loved having it keeping him aware of anything that he should be aware of ahead up front or to the side or all around basically keeping him aware at all time.
customer_reviews.author: faye peyton

customer_reviews.title: It's ok for price
customer_reviews.text: It's ok but goes off when it wants to no matter what mode you have it set to and the one time I did pass a cop it didnt make a sound. Got pulled over and the first thing that came to mind was WHERE WERE YOU!!!!
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: No a fan of it.
customer_reviews.text: Goes off for no reason whatsoever. We live out in the middle of nowhere and it will go of with nothing but fields around me with any cars for miles. It isn't like the old day ones that was simple to understand.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Czajkowski

customer_reviews.title: They are easy to learn how to use.
customer_reviews.text: I liked the price, less than 50.00 bucks. You save five times that the first time you avoid a speeding ticket by LEARNING how to use this simple but effective device. I am always amazed that people master 1000.00 dollar cell phones w/ ease, yet a little ole 44.00 dollar radar detector has em babbling ridiculous excuses as to why they wont get one. Fine w/ me,cause to many of us using them and they might just go to all laser to keep up the revenue stream.
customer_reviews.author: john m.

customer_reviews.title: Stop!!!! Don’t waste your money!!!!
customer_reviews.text: It constantly goes off!!! We have put it on city mode and highway and the thing won’t shut the heck up!! It constantly says k 8, K9 or Ka 8 or Ka9... worst purchase ever!!! Don’t waste your money. Like it’s not even worth ten dollars! It won’t save you from a ticket unless you just don’t speed because it is constantly going off so you would constantly be worried to go over speed limit!! Worthless piece of garbage! Going to send back!
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: Lots of noise-not too helpful
customer_reviews.text: Makes a lot of noise. I passed by at least 4 police officers and it never went off but makes noise for traffic lights and a lot of stuff I didn't want to know about. I put it on city mode and it was mode quite. But at the end of the day it wasn't doing what I wanted which was to detect Radar from police so i dont get speeding tickets.
customer_reviews.author: ian Coyne

customer_reviews.title: Not Very Good
customer_reviews.text: K Band filter is non-existent. Detector absolutely useless in a city environment with BSM installed on almost every new car sold! No way to disable K band. This detector is pointless to purchase.
customer_reviews.author: climb4

customer_reviews.title: good cheep radar detoctor
customer_reviews.text: It is a good cheep radar detector, give you enough warning to stay out of the way. Cons are the fact that it seam to be short of range, but still enough time to slow down.
customer_reviews.author: Eric T. Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Good bang for the buck
customer_reviews.text: Good for the price. Works for KA. Randomly goes off for laser when no lasers around. City mode still beeps for k band too much. But main thing is most cops use KA and this seems to pick it up decently good Distance is decent enough to slow down if you’re not haulin ass
customer_reviews.author: Courtney Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't always detect cops
customer_reviews.text: It's really cool. Love it. But it doesn't detect the cop car, it detects its radar and Lazar, so Some cops can turn them off. But it's still worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Miss.Mai

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: It detects well but does give s bunch of false readings. Expected from cheaper ones but I am satisfied. I am satisfied but not enough to give more than 3/5 stars
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Knowles

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY! I bought this because i went ...
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY! I bought this because i went on a road trip around the country. it doesn't work, do not detects anything, and it it does, it will detect the signal when you are about 1 meter away from the cops, which is not helpful at all.
customer_reviews.author: Ling Ling

customer_reviews.title: Pretty accurate
customer_reviews.text: Took me a little time to get used to how it operates, but it has saved me from many tickets I'm sure! It activates with enough time for me to slow down before I get lit up. Worth the money for me.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie

customer_reviews.title: Radar Detector
customer_reviews.text: This product was bought in March and it is working well. It has detected speed traps, and hiding speed radars. We are satisfied with this purchase so far.
customer_reviews.author: coopertipsy

customer_reviews.title: Police will know whenever it is turned on.
customer_reviews.text: Easily detected by police. Make sure it is legal to use before you turn it on.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: A button got stuck inside the scanner 😩 just completely fell into the device not too long after purchase. Next buy I’ll pay a little more for something more durable
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: it's very simple to use and the price was great. I bought one 3 years ago when I ...
customer_reviews.text: bought this for my husband for his new truck. it's very simple to use and the price was great. I bought one 3 years ago when I bought my new Speed3. It's saved me many times. Can't beat the price.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi

customer_reviews.title: Randomly stopped working
customer_reviews.text: so besides the product literally picking up every radio scan that you could possibly pick up the unit for the price it was work's decently and tell it didn't work at all for no reason
customer_reviews.author: Broderick Vollbrecht

customer_reviews.title: False alarms
customer_reviews.text: OMG this detector goes off every time the wind blows in the wrong direction. I’ve had it about four weeks now and the false alarms are non stop when truckers are nearby. The price is cheap, but it gets to the point you ignore the alerts if there are truckers in sight. Don’t know if it’s any better or worse than higher priced models, but it’s just a distraction at this point.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The mounting for this device was lousey
customer_reviews.text: The mounting for this device was latterly a joke. three suctions for the device would not stay on the windshield and the cord to plug It in was not long enough to hold it in place. I purchased Velcro and stuck it on the device, and to my cars dash board, and is working better.
customer_reviews.author: Troy Miller

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: This works for the most part. Sometimes we can seam to figure out why it’s beeping but the times there has been a scanner around it does detect it
customer_reviews.author: Virginia Vasquez

customer_reviews.title: Early Warning System
customer_reviews.text: Very good and reliable radar detector. Easy to install and easy to use. Do recommend.
customer_reviews.author: SonnyR

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: Lots of false alarms, picks up radar emitted by modern vehicles that have blind spot monitoring, parking assist sensors, adaptive cruise control, etc... Quality of the unit itself isn’t bad, still has saved me from speeding tickets but it cries wolf often.
customer_reviews.author: Gary F.

customer_reviews.title: Good, if you're on a budget, but I'd recommend one that remembers your settings.
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't remember your settings, so you have to re-do those each time. Also, has an obnoxious alarm when it thinks that emergency vehicles are nearby, when they're not, meanwhile does nothing when emergency vehicles ACTUALLY go by.
customer_reviews.author: Derek S.

customer_reviews.title: Whistler Radar Detector
customer_reviews.text: Excellent. It does everything that I want to do with a radar detector and I have never had any problems with it.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Perfect alert!
customer_reviews.text: All around perfect for everyday use. Picks up only what you need it to. Great audio and visual alert system that is guaranteed to work on any condition
customer_reviews.author: Fatboy13

customer_reviews.title: No Tickets No Problems
customer_reviews.text: So far no tickets. Extremely sensitive so you'll know if police are hiding in a speed trap. Great price so I have one in every car and truck.
customer_reviews.author: Shopping Star

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Great product, I’d rather have false positives than false negatives!
customer_reviews.author: Kcoats

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: We love this product I need to purchase another soon
customer_reviews.author: george

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: This works great, is easy to setup, and does it job by letting me know when a cop is nearby so I can slow down. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Dillard

customer_reviews.title: so far so good and hasnt failed to detect a single cop
customer_reviews.text: it works although it gets some false alarms but hasnt fail to announce that a cop is far in front of me that i can't see him
customer_reviews.author: andres lillo

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these, one for myself and one for a friend as a gift. My friend’s cord at plug in “shredded” for lack of better terms about 2 months ago AND the other day mine did the exact same thing!!
customer_reviews.author: Jocelyn Bradford

customer_reviews.title: Recommended as a beginner radar detector.
customer_reviews.text: This detector works great for general use. I use mine everyday and it picks up almost everything. Installation is just plugging it in and sticking on the front window. Both super easy to install & use. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Tibbetts

customer_reviews.title: Great price.
customer_reviews.text: Paid for itself in the first week. Plenty of warning time, close to a mile i would say, downside is things like onstar set it off or farm tractor gps. different tone for that. it will stay flashing if the car in front or behind is using onstar or whatever. i am not sure if radar would over ride that or not.
customer_reviews.author: Cloudfeather Bigthunder

customer_reviews.title: Only lasted 8 months, will company fix it?
customer_reviews.text: Reason for 1 star over all is that mine only lasted 8 months and just stopped working a week ago...is there a way to contact the supplier through here to fix it or will I just have to buy another one? If the supplier can not fix it then I’d want one that would last longer...a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Kelley Calhoun

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the $20
customer_reviews.text: Some false positives, but well worth the cost. I’m happy with my purchase. Thanks for making an affordable radar detector.
customer_reviews.author: Na

customer_reviews.title: Too many false alarms, even when set to city mode ...
customer_reviews.text: Too many false alarms, even when set to city mode and driving in the middle of rural nowhere-ville. Haven't been able to associate any alarms with actual radars.
customer_reviews.author: amchudyk

customer_reviews.title: Great for road trips!
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Used it on a long road trip and detected just about everything and helped us avoid speed traps!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Vargas

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money..
customer_reviews.text: This thing seriously goes off every 30 damn seconds. Not reliable at all, it doesnt do anything when I put it in quiet mode or when I turn the volume down.
customer_reviews.author: KHallford

customer_reviews.title: Money saver
customer_reviews.text: Best bag for your buck and will save you a lot of money on tickets with this it’s worth every penny
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: Decent
customer_reviews.text: Worked well for a month. Then the outlet cord went out on me. And I miss the return date so couldn’t return it. However the actual company (Whistler) sells power cords. So if you have a similar problem it could solve it. However it’s $15 not including shipping. So now I’m just trying to cheaper options to work with it.
customer_reviews.author: Adam DeLong

customer_reviews.title: Small and potent
customer_reviews.text: Petite size and effective warning. Video game sounds when turned on.
customer_reviews.author: smac1968

customer_reviews.title: Worked fine. Since it picks up signals we are not ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine. Since it picks up signals we are not necessarily looking for, we don't use it any more. We just have to remember to drive within the speed limit.
customer_reviews.author: Kay F.

customer_reviews.title: Worth it.
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for. In this case, you get a temperamental, over-sensitive radar detector. But all it took was a beep on a dark country road to tell me that there was a cop around the corner. It has saved me one ticket, and that means it has already paid for itself.
customer_reviews.author: ninten

customer_reviews.title: great unit
customer_reviews.text: Many people do not understand that is only a HELP to detect the radar signals, its not magic, it cant detect if the radar/laser is not turned on, but when you understand that, and you learn how to read the signal warnings your are gong to love it. It save me a couple time!, it really works!
customer_reviews.author: Amezky Ing

customer_reviews.title: Also the beeping sounds so annoying. It reminds me of my game boy in ...
customer_reviews.text: I pass cops and it does not ring, then at times it rings and nothing around. Also the beeping sounds so annoying. It reminds me of my game boy in the 1990's. Smh, dont even bother with your money!
customer_reviews.author: Johanna Torres

customer_reviews.title: WHISTLER RADAR DETECTOR
customer_reviews.text: THIS IS MY FOURTH WHISTLER THEY WORK FOR ME. I HAD TWO TALKING DETECTORS A COBRA AND A WHISTLER BOTH STOPPED TALKING,WHEN THAT HAPPENS THEY DONT EVEN MAKE GOOD PAPER WEIGHTS TOO LITE ! I AM NOT A RADAR DETECTOR EXPERT OR A SPEED FREAK BUT WHERE I LIVE THE POLICE RUN RADAR EVER DAY IN TOWN THE SPEED LIMIT IS 40 MPH. IF THEY HAVE THEIR RADAR UNIT ON MY WHISTLER PICK IT UP IN TIME FOR ME TO CHECK MY SPEED .
customer_reviews.author: george vinson

customer_reviews.title: doesn't always work does most of the time,
customer_reviews.text: I just bough this product 2 weeks ago and I got pulled over for speeding today. It didnt go off untill i got in front of of the cop
customer_reviews.author: jennifer troy

customer_reviews.title: This thing rocks. I originally questioned it because of ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing rocks. I originally questioned it because of how cheap in $ it was. However, it saved me many times on my way to work.
customer_reviews.author: Janelle Janke

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Great for the price will get the job done not the best on the market but you can’t expect the best with this price
customer_reviews.author: Nick johnson

customer_reviews.title: You get what you paid for
customer_reviews.text: This is a rare detector it does work when you have it on City mode on highway it's a bit touchy but it does work
customer_reviews.author: Chris Cuevas

customer_reviews.title: Good but no so good.
customer_reviews.text: Is good but not really good. I lost by accident the aluminum tip to conect at the cigarette plug in my car, replace it with a different one, and after that never worked again. Make sure is located in a good place in your car. Doesn't scan too well behind you.
customer_reviews.author: Raynolds Cardoza

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: It does what it says but if you’re buying this to alert you from cops it doesn’t do that, it picks up anything but that, I drove past two cop cars and it didn’t make a peep. It detects literally any frequency especially cars that have parking sensors so it honestly is a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: You need to know what settings it needs to be on.
customer_reviews.text: Works great but it doesn't pick up everything! I haven't figured out exactly what the settings need to be set on. I'll see a police car and sometimes it beeps and sometimes it doesn't.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: works really well almost always see them before they see me
customer_reviews.author: Mike Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Great packaging. Will use again when need arises
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived as advertised. Great packaging. Will use again when need arises. Recommended to everyone.
customer_reviews.author: Magnum79

customer_reviews.title: Worked for 6 months
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for 6 months now it's dead. Turns on and screen goes black. I wouldn't recommend this item
customer_reviews.author: Tonya Richardson

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Sometimes have to put on City mode due ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Sometimes have to put on City mode due to picking up stray X band or K band. I leave it on Hwy mode 95% of the time. A friend of mine has been using the Whistler XTR-265 for over a year and recommended it to me. I bought one for myself and used it for about a month. I liked it so well, I bought another one for my wife's car.
customer_reviews.author: D. Locke

customer_reviews.title: 1000 mile trip was a huge win
customer_reviews.text: saved me from several tickets and speedtraps. paid for itself first 200 miles of use. im not speeder but its easy to do while driving from sacramento to los angeles. this radar combined with Waze GPS app saved me from every speedtrap on the freeway. not too hot for city use, but those long, clear, hundred mile stretches.... major plus! will use this till i get a gps enabled radar. works well for its price,notify you when police are rolling nearby.
customer_reviews.author: Moyshe oofnik

customer_reviews.title: Decent radar, does the job
customer_reviews.text: Overall a great product.... Only complaint is that the port that the power cord plugs into the unit is made pretty cheap. I had to tape the cord to the unit with electrical tape after only using it for a month...
customer_reviews.author: MzLed

customer_reviews.title: Good for the money
customer_reviews.text: Gets a lot of false readings but overall good value for the money
customer_reviews.author: Francis Paul Miller

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: Beeps all the time I had to unplug it. Had my buddy test it by doing everything with his squad car and didn't work
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Needs improvement, cable jack is very lose and speaker sounds awful. Mounting brace is also designed poorly.
customer_reviews.author: Juan Ibarra

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Decent detector. After a fee years the speaker no longer works. But, has been a great product and still is.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Loomis

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: By the time the device picks up the signal the cops are already in site..
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cheap quality
customer_reviews.text: Didn't even last 3 months and the screen quit working
customer_reviews.author: Brandon sterritt

customer_reviews.title: Good choice
customer_reviews.text: This won't protect you from a ticket or detect a cop whose radar gun is down, but nothing really will. Instead, the incessant warnings from this device will keep you mindful about your speed. That's the real benefit of most radar detectors, and this one is a discrete and affordable option.
customer_reviews.author: S. Fraser

customer_reviews.title: Iffy
customer_reviews.text: It’s a little confusing to get started, in my opinion, and sometimes it doesn’t even work so that’s a bummer but I mean it still works sometimes so idk
customer_reviews.author: kekoa Kaaihue

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work well
customer_reviews.text: I will drive right past a cop and it won't go off. Other times it will just start going off for no reason at all. Does not work very well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: Has really good coverage. Saved me several times while late to work. Small on the dash so it’s out of the way.
customer_reviews.author: Amber Vanderhoof

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: Love this ! Works great and has saved me from a lot of speeding tickets already! Worth every cent. Highly recommend this. I bought 2 of them. One for me and one for the husband. We both love them and use them daily in our vehicles.
customer_reviews.author: Malerie Jane

customer_reviews.title: Small display, false alarms on car radar
customer_reviews.text: The display looks nothing like the photo, the lettering and numbers are a lot smaller. It false alarms on car radar and stuff but I guess you can't have too high of expectations from a $30 radar I would say it's met expectations
customer_reviews.author: KVD

customer_reviews.title: Buy me
customer_reviews.text: Great little value I would recommend it it works great for me for the money
customer_reviews.author: Timothy golden

customer_reviews.title: Okay
customer_reviews.text: Still on fence. Beeps a lot ...on and on actually seemingly unecessarily. He seems to like it though.
customer_reviews.author: visibleinvisiblereader

customer_reviews.title: Great item for people who love speeding
customer_reviews.text: I speed all the time, everywhere I go. Drive a Jaguar XJR. This thing picks up EVERY cop all the time, and it gives you more than enough notice to slam on those brakes. Perfect device, would have paid $2000 for it because it has probably saved me over $5000 in speeding tickets. Definitively would recommend it to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: M13804

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for $20 Prime Day :)
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good, $20 (prime day)!!! Why would I spend more?
customer_reviews.author: AV BG IL

customer_reviews.title: It works pretty great I can leave it plugged in in my ...
customer_reviews.text: It works pretty great I can leave it plugged in in my truck and it will not kill the battery and it has surprisingly warned me far ahead before I could even see a police vehicle. I think that it is definitely worth the amount of money you pay for it if you cannot afford an expensive one
customer_reviews.author: Sean G.

product_meta.title: Whistler XTR-145 Laser Radar Detector: 360 Degree Protection, Icon Display, and Tone Alerts
product_meta.description:
The Whistler XTR-145 radar detection provides total band protection against all radar guns used today - including X-band, K-band, Superwide Ka-band and laser. It delivers 360 degrees of complete perimeter protection, detecting signals from the front, sides, and rear. The icon display provides distinct visual symbols of alerts detected and engaged modes, while the tone alerts provide audible alerts for bands received. Alert periscopes provide an additional visual alert by displaying LED’s on top of the unit. Features VG-2 detection, vehicle battery saver that shuts off the radar detector when not in use, and alert priority, as well as 3 city modes that reduce the annoyance of false alerts caused by common X-band radar sources such as security systems or door openers. Included with the radar detector is a power cord, windshield bracket kit, a user guide, and a limited 1 year manufacturer warranty. Permits operation of traffic radar guns at X Band(10.500 - 10.550 GHz),K Band (24.050 - 24.250 GHz), and Ka Band (33.400 - 36.000 GHz). Note: A radar detector will only alarm if an officer is transmitting on any one of the above radar bands

AMAZON.COM
Whistler's XTR-145 is an affordable, full-featured laser/radar detector. With total band protection from radar signals, 360-degree laser detection, Whistler's patented VG-2 cloaking technology, and plenty more, you'll get an effective detector that doesn't break the bank.

Effective detection that doesn't break the bank. 
Click to enlarge. 

4.41 x 2.84 x 1.35 inches and just 5.4 ounces. 

This unit features Whistler's low-profile "alert periscope" LEDs that flash when the unit alarms. 

Total Band Protection
Provides Complete Band Coverage of all Laser, Radar (X, K, and Ka bands), VG-2, and Safety Radar bands. 

Icon Display
The XTR-145's bright icon display offers easy-to-read display to indicate power, city mode, radar band identification, and signal strength. 

360 Degree Protection
Units with 360 protection detect signals from all radar, laser, VG-2 and safety radar systems wherever they come from; front, rear or from the side. 

VG-2 Cloaking
The VG-2, also known as a "radar detector detector," is a special receiver used by police to detect signals radiated by a radar detector. Thanks to Whistler's patented VG-2 cloaking technology, your detector will remain invisible to VG-2 detection. 

3 City Modes/Highway Mode
Highway mode provides full audio and visual warning of laser/radar systems while maintaining full sensitivity, and is the default setting of Whistler laser/radar detectors. City mode helps reduce the annoyance of automatic door openers and burglar alarm alerts by providing an initial alert (same distance as Highway Mode) then remaining quiet unless the signal strength becomes very strong. When the signal increases the unit will alert briefly to notify you of the change in signal strength. 

Quiet/Auto Quiet Modes
Pressing QUIET before a signal is detected engages Auto Quiet Mode, which automatically reduces the audio level after the initial warning to a low audio level setting. Pressing QUIET during a radar/laser encounter silences audio alerts, while allowing visual alerts to keep you informed. 

Vehicle Battery Saver Mode
The Vehicle Battery Saver Mode automatically shuts off your detector within 3 hours if you forget to turn it off. The timer is reset if the detector is turned off, unplugged or any button is pressed before the 6 hours have expired. The detector will alert you with an audible and visual warning before it shuts off. 

Alert Priority
When two or more signals are received at the same time, the alert priority is: Laser, VG-2, Speed Radar, Safety Radar. 

Example: If X band is alerting, then suddenly a VG-2 signal is detected, the VG-2 warning will override the X band alert. 

Twin Alert Periscopes
Whistler's Low Profile Alert Periscopes provide an added attention getting visual alert. The two extra LEDs flash on and off when the unit alarms to provide a unique visual alert. 

What's in the Box
Whistler XTR-145 Radar/Laser Detector, Windshield Mount, Power Cord, User's Manual

Protection against all radar guns including X-band, K-band, Superwide Ka-band, and laser
Icon display provides distinct visual symbols of alerts detected and engaged modes; Tone alerts provide audible alerts for bands received
